website_summaries.verdict: For hikers needing a kind of boot that has excellent comfort and ankle support, the Hedgehog Fastpack Mid GTX from The North Face has arrived. Their quest for something light, grippy, and waterproof need not continue either as the boot also possesses such qualities in great amounts. That being said, the gear might scare some people away with its allegedly deficient outsole. Overall, the Hedgehog Fastpack Mid GTX is a showstopper with all of its good points factored in. Prospective buyers just need to be extra careful with its outsole and not subject it to much abuse.
pros: The Hedgehog Fastpack Mid GTX surpassed the expectations of numerous verified purchasers with its impressive level of comfort
This day hiking boot received great reviews from droves of owners for being dependably waterproof
Its dreamy lightness astounded quite a number of users
Many wearers couldn’t help but commend the Hedgehog Fastpack Mid GTX for being reliably grippy
More than a dozen reviewers expressed their appreciation of the boot’s unshakable ankle support
A moderate percentage of reports described the footgear’s fit as one-to-one
Several female hikers found the Hedgehog Fastpack Mid GTX stunningly cute
Testers by the handful felt compelled to call the boot amazingly breathable
cons: Some users condemned the boot’s outsole for having tread patterns that degrade too quickly
Its thin, cushion-less insole was mocked by a very few

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for wider feet
customer_reviews.text: Size as expected, plenty of toe room, very lightweight. Vibram soles are fab: grippy, light and cushy, like standing on clouds! Needs a little more arch support, which is not really a big deal as it’s easy to find good half insoles with decent arch support around. Great ankle support for pronation. Fits wider feet perfectly. Will report back after wearing in rain etc. So far very pleased with the looks, quality and comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boot On First Hike
customer_reviews.text: First time i've purchased hiking boots , I looked at several brands and eventually settled on these. I went on the Fan Dance Challenge 29th Feb 2020 , storm Jorge met us head on ! These boots needed no breaking in but I did remove the thin insole and in its place use a thicker foam sole. The boots had very good grip and appeared to be water proof , comfortable and light weight . 6 hours of Brecon Beacons and I can say these boots proved to be excellent.
customer_reviews.author: jattnetwork

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Had these boots now for 2 and half weeks. Since then I've taken them out a three day hike through the Wicklow mountains, over rugged and sometimes wet terrain. As well as this I took them on a hiking holiday in La Palma. They've been extremely comfortable and from what I've experienced so far waterproof. I'll try keep this updated.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe north face has made such a poor product. Boots felt flimsy and a friend actually laughed when he see them cause he owned these once before. Had them a couple of days and I got wet socks the minute they got in contact with water. Returned for refund
customer_reviews.author: Miss Vicky Zurinskas

customer_reviews.title: Delighted....
customer_reviews.text: These arrived within two days and wasn't expected for at least 5... The boots are so comfortable and a great design.... I looked at loads of boots before purchasing and glad I did... Best boots I've ever had... By a million miles.... Let's hope I get that out of them 😆 UPDATE.... After using these for a couple of weeks now have found they are really slippery under foot.... Both on wet and frosty ground.... Just an issue which some would like to know
customer_reviews.author: Sean Keenan

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: These are the most expensive boots I have ever owned, and the least waterproof. I was looking for a pair of waterproof walking boots and chose these based on the description and reviews. They have a gore-tex lining, so I was expecting a good level of water resistance. Unfortunately, this is not the case. Simply walking over damp grass results in wet socks. I thought they must be faulty, so I returned them, however the replacement pair are exactly the same. Apart from that, they are reasonably comfortable and very light.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Geoffrey Conway

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my husband & he loves them! He has gone through many a pair of walking boots but buy cheap pay twice as they say! Spending that little extra is well worth it. He tells me they are very comfortable and is very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today on time first thing I noticed was the weight of the parcel I thought they had sent slippers they were that light, tried them on perfect fit, light and good ankle support and it was like walking on air, so I told my wife I would try them out and went to the pub, they were that fast I got an extra pint in. On a serious note they are the best boots I have ever owned and I have tried lots, they are not cheap but well worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Grant D.

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: They leak at the front where the plastic is stitched. Takes a couple of hours in long wet grass/mud/water but they leak. Scotchguard on the stitching means they don't leak for 4-5 hours. Starting to think I should look elsewhere for boots which don't leak.
customer_reviews.author: John Naismith

customer_reviews.title: Holes in my boots !
customer_reviews.text: Great fit- went for 1/2 size bigger to accommodate thicker socks. I found these boots very comfortable. However, less than a year (06/2019), of purchase, one hole has appeared near the toe of the right boot, and a split has developed in the material of the left boot- see attached photos. I intend returning them, not necessarily for a refund, but to bring to the manufacturer's attention a potential flaw in the boot design construction.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Robert N. K. Halling

customer_reviews.title: Top quality
customer_reviews.text: These boots are lightweight, comfortable and very sturdy without restricting movement. Only worn them once on a short hike but 1st impression is they are well worth the money paid 👍
customer_reviews.author: james elliott

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Went off to the peak district for a weekend, they kept my feet dry in long wet grass and puddles. Didn't find any streams to test them out tho. Walked about 20 miles on all terrains. Didn't get any blisters or rubbing. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cas

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 9 months and they leak!
customer_reviews.text: They were great to start with.... The waterproofing only lasted about a month and retreating them didn’t make much difference. The biggest issue though is that they haven’t lasted very long. They’re used for lane & track dog walking. After 9 months they have split in several places and the sole is beginning to come away on one of them. I expected more from a £93 pair or walking boots.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfie 267

customer_reviews.title: Nice style but runs small.
customer_reviews.text: Nice style and features, but does run small. I’m a 8.5/9 normally, and as with most items of clothing it can be hit me miss getting it right. My feet just fit these in an 8.5 with normal socks.
customer_reviews.author: Htegg

customer_reviews.title: A great lightweight walking boot.
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight yet comfortable. Supportive around the ankle and your typically high build quality you come to expect from North Face.
customer_reviews.author: Bowlch

customer_reviews.title: An all round good boot
customer_reviews.text: So far they have been great. Really light weight with a good grippy sole. Been out in all weathers and terrain and they are extremely waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: lee simmons

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately they are not water proof at all. I bought the first pair and after 6 months they were let water in leaning my feet wet. Amazon replace it with a new pair and unfortunately this pair let water in only after a month. Not worth the price even if I really like them and they are really comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, holding up strong after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: These boots are awesome quality. I wear them almost daily and after 8 months no signs of the sole espera ring or holes. Breathable too so can happily wear them on a warm day
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Ok boots, slight flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Good boots but too narrow for me, and make noise like flip flop when walking.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Cousins

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever, thank you NorthFace 👍🏻👌🏻👊🏻
customer_reviews.text: best boots ever, very happy with the quality and fit, been snowboarding took them in deep snow, rain etc and couldn’t ask for a better product. 150% recommended. Thank you NorthFace, you never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Razvan

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I have great trouble being on my feet for any length of time. These are ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: My left shoe was not waterproof and let in a lot of water on a walk in wet grasses. The right one was fine. Apart from that the boots were excellent although I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: jgratton

customer_reviews.title: Comfort is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I use these boots for casual use with jeans and shorts. Excellent comfort and lightweight but superb quality.
customer_reviews.author: Coxonsplectrum

customer_reviews.title: Superb walking shoe - sturdy, comfy, good value
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't have hoped for better - nice and comfy, waterproof, warm, do a great job on easy and tough walks alike.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great price for quality item
customer_reviews.text: Great boots,had a few issues but were resolved quickly and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: ian  shade

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable boots with great support and keeps water out well.
customer_reviews.text: I wore these for hiking ben Nevis recently on a very wet and windy day. They kept the water out well and were very comfy without the need to "break them in". I can't fault them. I'm ex Army, and know a good boot when I wear one!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Superb, one walk in were already very comfortable with great support.
customer_reviews.author: John Cecchini

customer_reviews.title: Warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: Great boot and fit. The main thing for me is that my feet are warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: BART

customer_reviews.title: North face boots great quality item.
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. Fit like a glove straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great so far 👍
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable from the moment I put them on, I haven’t done a lot of walking in them yet, but so far so good, no rubbing and waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Went hiking in up Snowdon which was the first time wearing the boots. No blisters, feet were bone dry and really Light weight. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small for size
customer_reviews.text: I take a 9 or 10 for most shoes. These were to short so I exchanged for a 10.5. May need to go to an 11. Not worn yet but appear to be ok
customer_reviews.author: J WILLIAMS

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: A surprisingly lightweight feel, don’t know about the waterproofing at the moment, but hoping they’ll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Jak E Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Great boot extremely comfortable and so far no wet feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable right out of the box. Hiked in all conditions with those and have not let me down once.
customer_reviews.author: william

product_meta.title: The North Face Men's Hedgehog Fastpack Mid GTX High Rise Hiking Boots
product_meta.description: These men's hedgehog fast pack mid gore-tex (eu) shoes from The North Face feature a cradle guide midsole, and a durable vibram outsole. A gore-tex membrane locks out the wet to keep your feet dry come spring showers or shallow streams. The abrasion-resistant, breathable textile mesh provides added durability and ventilation, while an ortholite foot bed gives long-lasting comfort – ideal for day-long treks.
feature_bullets: Mountain Footwear > Men's > Trekking Boots > Mid
